summary: Des Moines is Iowa's capital and biggest city. It was founded in 1851 and named after the Des Moines River, which means "River of the Monks" in French. As of 2020, over 214,000 people live there, and it's a major center for insurance, finance, and publishing. Many big companies are based there, and it's important in presidential politics because it hosts the first caucuses of the election cycle.
title: Des Moines, Iowa
